pros: Feels like you are working with family. WVMC cares about the employees and the community.
cons: We need more good people to work here to build up our team.

review_title: Great clinical staff, exceedingly poor Management and Administration
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA II in McMinnville, OR
pros: Clinical nursing and physicians are excellent, working hard despite lack of support from management and administration.
cons: Excessive turnover at administrative and managerial level through several mergers and acquisitions. Strong anti-labor practices from management and administration.

pros: Great coworkers, decent pay rate

Management does not understand the function of pharmacy

pros: Most of the staff are friendly

review_title: Public faith of WVMC in decline.
job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician in McMinnville, OR
pros: Because of their location, they are able to service the local population for many of their needs.
cons: Communication between management and the regular staff is practically non-existent, or if a plan is verbalized, it may often fall through.  There is significant disrespect among staffs members themselves, as well as management towards staff members.  There are also the chosen golden staff that can do no wrong.  The unfair aspect if this is easy visible by others.  The stability of the company is questionable, having been through two buyouts in a years time.  Diversity is not one of the company's strong suits.

pros: Easy to get hired as a New Grad.
cons: Med Sure nursing can be understaffed. High turn over rate. Not able to use extended illness bank until you use up 3 days of PTO. 401K match is delayed and there is no notice of when WVMC will match.

review_title: Have worked at WVMC for 5 years
pros: Great place to work.  Excellent and engaged medical staff.  Patients get amazing care.
cons: Poor reputation in the local community.  Uphill battle, but we do seem to be making some head way.  Now have a full time marketing manager

pros:
** Great Staff
** Best Nurse Manager; really cares about her staff and our opinions
** Adequate nurse to patient ratio
cons: ** None that I can think of a present time. This is a great place to work and I can't see myself quiting anytime soon.

pros: The employees give amazing care to the patients and to each other.  The work environment is very supportive of one another and feels like a big family.  The CEO is the best LEADER I have ever worked for in my career.
cons: The traffic to Portland is a pain sometimes.
